channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MT

item.title: Report X-2023100529
item.description:
Report X-2023100529

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: BILLINGS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found leaking on the unload side. upon inspection the package was found to have a leaking jug of acetone caused by a loose cap. DescribePack: loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: put in red lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023100387
item.description:
Report X-2023100387

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: BUTTE
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED FROM TRAILER FOLLOWING PROPER METHODS. EMPLOYEE POINTED OUT WET BOTTOM OF BOX AND THAT IT WAS HAZMAT MARKED. WAS IMMEADIATELY CONTAINED IN SPILL TRAY AND TAKEN TO PROCESSING AREA BY DESIGNATED RESPONDER.

item.title: Report X-2023090453
item.description:
Report X-2023090453

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: GREAT FALLS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UTLX 221513 was noted to be leaking from the top of the car during yard movement. After investigation, the leak was noted to be coming from the manway. The swing bolts were tool-tight, however after opening the manway lid, it was noted that the manway gasket was missing. A new manway gasket was installed and the swing bolts tool-tightened. The car was cleaned and release into transportation.
